intro: Seriphidium kopetdaghense, commonly known as the Kopetdagh tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Kopetdagh region of Turkmenistan and Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic properties. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Seriphidium kopetdaghense is valued for its medicinal uses and is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
